target_title: Import of certificate with seahorse does not work; Import button stays disabled

note.body:
I have never been able to import certificates from .p12/.pfx files to sign with LibreOffice. I always faced this very same problem where I can open the file but the import button stays grayed out (with no feedback on what to do).

seahorse 47.0.1, gnome-keyring 46.2 @ Manjaro

I did what @detrout suggested, I commented out the enable-in line and was able to import the .pfx certificate. However it does not appear in LibreOffice to sign. Moreover, the certificate has been imported to the "Gnome2 Key Storage", which is supposedly locked (lock icon), but in fact is not (I can read, export and delete the certificate).

target_title: Default keyring deleted after system update, reboot

note.body:
Whenever this happens, could you run the following commands and attach their output so we could get some diagnostic information?

- `gdbus call --session --dest org.freedesktop.secrets --object-path /org/freedesktop/secrets --method org.freedesktop.Secret.Service.ReadAlias '"default"'`
- `gdbus call --session --dest org.freedesktop.secrets --object-path /org/freedesktop/secrets/aliases/default --method org.freedesktop.Secret.Collection.SearchItems '{}'`
- any suspicious (errors, warnings) gnome-keyring logs in journalctl

note.body:
> Passwords and Keys (Seahorse) version: 41.0

Hi @jakub.lorenc, thanks for reporting this. Unfortunately you are using a 37 month old version which is not supported anymore by GNOME developers. There will not be any bug fixes or feature additions by GNOME developers for the version that you use.

Please feel free to reopen this issue if this situation still happens with a more recent version of GNOME. Feel also free to report this in the issue tracking system of your Linux distribution if your Linux distribution still supports your current version.

target_title: Flathub verification
reproducible builds issue
build: Fix config.h target
build: Fix config.h target
build: Fix config.h target
reproducible builds issue

note.body:
I found another hint. The `@VCS_TAG@` comes in via config.h and that is written in two places.
First by

    "/usr/bin/meson", "setup", "--buildtype=plain", "--prefix=/usr", "--libdir=/usr/lib64", "--libexecdir=/usr/libexec", "--bindir=/usr/bin", "--sbindir=/usr/sbin", "--includedir=/usr/include", "--datadir=/usr/share", "--mandir=/usr/share/man", "--infodir=/usr/share/info", "--localedir=/usr/share/locale", "--sysconfdir=/etc", "--localstatedir=/var", "--sharedstatedir=/var/lib", "--wrap-mode=nodownload", "--auto-features=enabled", ".", "x86_64-suse-linux", "-Dpgp-support=true", "-Dcheck-compatible-gpg=true", "-Dpkcs11-support=true", "-Dkeyservers-support=true", "-Dhkp-support=true", "-Dldap-support=true", "-Dkey-sharing=true", "-Dmanpage=true"

called by [rpmbuild](https://code.opensuse.org/package/seahorse/blob/b21417354b285b3014eef618e456532f676a5f80/f/seahorse.spec#_80)

and later by

    "/usr/bin/meson", "--internal", "vcstagger", "config.h.in", "config.h", "43.0", "/home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/seahorse-43.0+22", "@VCS_TAG@", "(.*)", " "

called by ninja.
And the position of the 2nd call can vary significantly.
In one build log it appears as `[31/270]` and in another as `[157/270]`

target_title: Unable to load keyring since GNOME 45

note.body: I can confirm that this issue has happened to me as well. Restating the daemon with `gnome-keyring-daemon -r` fixes the issue for me.

target_title: Import of certificate with seahorse does not work; Import button stays disabled

note.body:
I was able to get it to work on Debian testing after editing /usr/share/p11-kit/modules/gnome-keyring.module to comment out the enable-in line, and I did have to restart seahorse to see the imported certificate.

It didn't work for me with an encrypted .p12 file, seahorse thought the file I could import into firefox was corrupted.

I managed to get it to work by imported the ascii format certificate with the private key appended to the file.

After all the work arounds I was able to sign a libreoffice document with a personal x.509 certificate.

I have

seahorse 47.0.1-1
libcr-4-4 4.3.0
libgcr-ui-3-1 3.41.2-1+b1
gnome-keyring 46.2-1

installed
